text: couldnt place the sweetness as maple...this seemed to be a lightly barrel aged sweet leaning cider, with hints of spice and vanilla, with any farmhouse character relegated to the background. Unique cider, and a nice seasonal. Drinks big.

Bottle. Cloudy gold. Aroma of maple syrup and vanilla. At first there is a little funk to adjust to. Quite sweet. Vanilla and maple syrup are obvious. Yeah very sweet but i like it. My wife found the amount of sweetness offputting.
Bottle. Cinnamon, maple/vanilla, sour apple, and straw aroma. Golden yellow. Very sweet maple, light cinnamon, apple juice and lightly bitter straw flavor. Nice body. Very sweet but nice.
This is a fantastic, high grade ballistic sweet chop of apples and funk. Rich, bordering on decadent. A nice after dinner drink I would think. A bit like a lighter ice cider.

Aroma is textbook apple pie filling: cinnamon, sweet baked apple, vanilla. Everything but the crust. Taste is the same, dominated by browned apple caramel. I think a lot of people would call it too sweet but for me it was like a nice brown cider with color to match. Will have again at holidays.
Geez, I had really high hopes for this one given how good the scrumpy northern gold was. But Im not picking up the vanilla or maple here at all

Bottle at BCS. Aroma is great. Apples, light funk, spice. Initially get the cinnamon but it is overwhelmed later. Taste is lovely, firstly apples, then sweetness, vanilla, pfeffernusse, rich and fruity. Little bit of spice but very smooth. Low carbonation. Really nice!
bottle .. . pours a dark tan .. no foam .. lots of the sweet sweet scrump! .. . full mouth, nice full finish .. a really great cider!! .. . . sheep really are fascinating..

Bottle shared by Tmoney99 from old notes. Pours a hazy light golden color with a few random bubbles. The aroma and flavor have fresh, sweet apple, mild cinnamon spice, a hint of maple syrup, honey, this is a bit better than many ciders, but....

I found this today at a local grocery store in the mountains and couldnt believe there was a JK there! The cider runs very sweet similar to an Angry Orchard Muse or Iceman but retains much of the flavors like some of the unfiltered Finnriver or deluxe Crispin. The maple is very distinct in it where it almost has a caramel flavor to it. I highly recommend this if youd like to try a naturally sweet cider that isnt as processed as many of the ones on the general market and is organic :)

Tap at Marciero. Glowing orange-amber with lace. nose of apple, some cinnamon, a bit of citrus. Huge juicy apple flavor, sweet and sour, lusciously balanced between them. Lightly but well spiced. Full and silky. This is really delicious, yet although it is not cloying, it is a bit too sweet to drink in quantity. These guys make great cider, though I prefer the tarter one.

Muddy Amber brown color. Big sweet nose with notes of stewed apples, vanilla, cinammon, with slight tartness. The mouth has low carbonation, slightly cloying, moderately sweet. Nice balance between sweetness and tartness. Lingeringn stewed apples and cinammon finish. Nice stuff.
Bottle. Pours clear orange with minimal white head. Aroma is tart, apples, vanilla. Taste is sweet, pruney, medium bodied, medium carbonation. Overall, its okay.
22 Oz Bomba. hazy gritty murky yellow brown. Almost no carbonation. Deep apple and spice nose. Light vanilla oak and apple.

Bottle from Total Wine. Rich gold pour without much head. Intense apple aroma, hints of cinnamon, very apple-pie. Strong powerful flavors, quite intensely sweet, rich apple, cinnamon, and a late solvent-like off flavor that detracts from the otherwise very nice whole. Moderately carbonated: not effervescent but not flat either. Even with that, though, its a gem if one is in the mood for a sweet (and lightly spiced) cider.

Bomber from Capones. Hay dark straw pour with minimal head. Nose is tart apple, cinnamon, grainy. Tastes very tart, with an intense apple flavor, notes of cinnamon, and a smooth finish. This one is great.

Sample courtesy of BiiruBierBeer, thanks Charles. It has a slightly hazy gold body. The aroma offers up straight up apple and a dash of earthiness. The taste is smooth sweet rich apple that again has an ever so slight sort of earthiness going on at the perceptible edges of the experience.
Sweet apple smell. Apple cinammon taste which I thought was good, but I like their Northern Neighbour cider better.
Good pour. Delicious. Apples, spices, maple, honey. Like a nice liquid apple pie. Tasty stuff.
Tastes like apples, cinnamon, vanilla and spices. Not usually a big cider fan but this is really good!
Really nice mixture of spice and apple, with a very nice vanilla touch with backing cinnamon. Really nice campfire drink.
From an old note: bottle shared at Proof. Sweet apple. Maple, spice, honey, cinnamon. Not a big cider fan, so grain of salt... 6.4
22oz bottle. Copper color, flat. Bold character at first taste. Smells of spiced cider. Strong. Tastes of over-ripened/cooked apples. Its alright. (4004)

Bomber from Total Wine in Sacramento, CA. Pours gold. Aroma is apple with a hint of cinnamon. Med body or nearly. Flavor is fairly sweet. apple. Small touch of cinnamon, and could be maple. Gets a little tart. But the finish is rather sweet.

From bottle at Naps. Pale straw golden clear with visible carbonation, topped with white foamy dissipating head. Terrific cider funky nose, fresh and macerated apples. A little sour, a little spicy with dry cider funk. Medium carbonation and body. Wonderful flavor. Tart, bright, and juicy with a hint of cinnamon. Mild funky finish with lingering sweetness. Very nice semi-dry cider, reminding me of a Normandy cider.
Pale bubbly pale yellow, no head. Aroma warm apple pie, cinnamon. Taste is home,are apple pie, sweet, spicy. Lingering sweetness. Maple and vanilla adds some mystery and depth to it. Yum

Pours hazy golden straw. No head, minimal carbonation. 
Aromas of apples, caramel, cinnamon
Flavor is like a warm roasted apple. Nice spicy finish with a strong taste of vanilla and alcohol warming the mouth.

Rated on 6-08-2010 (Bottle) This ciders appearance is a small fizzy head, hazy pale body, and fizzy carbonation. The aroma is sweet, maple, cinnamon, apples, vanilla, and tart. The taste is sweet, maple, vanilla, tart, apples, and slightly sour. The palate is smooth and this cider is medium bodied. Overall, this has a very different flavor for a cider and one that I cannot drink a whole lot of at one sitting. It is worth trying.

Bottle. Head is initially very small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing. Body is hazy medium yellow. Aroma is notes of decaying apple peels, apple juice, brown sugar, raisin. Flavor is heavily sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, fizzy carbonation.

The apple scent is sadly a bit rotten, and while I dont really get the impression of cinnamon or vanilla, theres definitely something adjuncty in it...seems more sugary than anything though. Mediocre and a bit novelty-ish.

Apples all the way through... Sweet and tangy with kicks all over... Initial smell is pretty potent and there is some kick in the taste ... Good... Drinks easy

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep hazy darker golden with a thin eggshell ring of "head." Nose is like baked apple pie with cinnamon, dusty pie crust, and bold apple. Nicely sweet, quite tart. Fuller bodied, syrupy, slick, softer carb, with a long tangy and spicy apple finish. Simply awesome. On another level.

Rating #878 - January 2, 2014 - 2nd review from Coop Beer Discovery Bag for January - My first cider review that I would consider craft-made. Clear, pale, fleshy pinky-yellow colour, fairly carbonated, bubbly foam dissipates rapidly. Aroma is caramelized apple, brown sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon. Palate is more of the same sweet notes, balanced by the dryness provided by the ripened fruit and alcohol fermentation. Not boozy in the slightest though, very drinkable. Delicious.

Wow. Great Cider. Sweat and slightly tart apple flavor. Then the vanilla hots you balanced with the maple syrup and cinnamon. Wonderfully balanced and tastes great. Only negative would be the price, at $6 or 7 a 22 oz bottle, it's not an every day cider.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a medium golden color with a finger of fizzy bubbles that gasses out quickly. The nose is sweet apple pie, vanilla, hints of seasoning and some more sweet candy apple. The palate follows with a light carbonation and a big cloyingly sweet palate that is much akin to actual unfermented apple cider. lots of sweet apple, traces of bitter peels, vanilla stick and mulling spices. Pretty tasty but a bit too sweet for me to fall in love with.
Almost no head. Golden colored. Rich taste. Heavily cider flavored, but light on the alcohol. This is a real crowd pleaser.
I am not sure why anyone would rate this above a 2. No apple taste, way too sweet, nothing good about it.

22 oz bottle- Pours slightly hazy golden. Aroma is strong in apples, tart and a little funky, apple pie aroma with the cinnamon and vanilla, appealing. The taste is again apples of course, apple pie spices, the maple syrup adds a depth that I really like, i think it creates a fuller cider, nice. Body is medium and the finish lingers leaving a nice spiced apple taste long after the swallow. Good.

Spectacular cider! Used to be called "J.K.s Solstice" and has now been cleverly renamed "Winterruption" but is the same tasty beverage in a different package. Huge mouthfeel, lots of character and balanced spices. The apple still shines through on this seasonal twist on the original. Try it mulled (warm) while toasting by the fire...
22 oz bottle shared. Pale and clear with minimal head. Aroma and flavor of apples, cinnamon, vanilla and other spices. Similar flavor with ample carbonation. Similar to Northern Neighbor.

Well, this was a really nice cider. Pours hazy orange with not much of a head to it. The aroma has mushy apples with a peach hint. There is also vanilla, light caramel and some spices - quite nice and inviting. It has a medium smooth body thats lush with light carbonation. The flavor starts off with smooth apple, caramel, spices and vanilla. The finish is lush and has some toffee and brown sugar aspects. Quite enjoyable.

Nice light nose of warm apples and cinnamon. Clear light gold. Light carbonation. Rich, round palate for a cider, fruit flavor drives a perception of sweetness, but fairly dry. Nice spice on the finish. Really nice fall sipper.

Bottle. Gold pour with a spotty ring of bubbles on the surface. Not too different from the color of apple juice. Aroma is apple juice with light cinnamon notes and baked apple pie. Taste is apple juice, apple jam, light cinnamon and baked apple pie. Body is light with faint carbonation and plenty of sugary stickiness. Ends with more apple pie notes, apple juice, candied apple and cinnamon.
Nice spice and apple aroma and taste, but more sweetness and alcohol than I need in a hard cider. Cloudy amber color.

Okay NOW were getting somewhere. Spicy, cloudy, delicious, appley. A bit too sweet to drink more than one, but a great starter cider for the evening.  Im tempted to heat it up with some cinnamon sticks and cloves...

At this point, this is the highest rated cider Ive ever had. 
The heat is on J.K.s Cuvée Winterruption Farmhouse Hard Cider... start liftin.

I like the nice pale straw color of the cider, I like the haziness, Its cool that there was a bit of head retention for a minute, but for a cider thats totally extra credit showoff stuff. 

The aroma is nice & reminds me of Sutliff Cider, its very apple-y & sweet smelling with light spice but never really enters the realm of apple soda. Some nice unfermented apple cider & some nice minerally bits in there, not especially complex but inviting enough. 

I can see from the flavor why this is well regarded. It is far more rich than most ciders tend to be, and its sweet in a way that isnt like apple soda much in the way that many sweet fermented ciders seem to be. Its sweeter than I would like it to be, but at the same time its got some serious things going for it. Specifically, its got this remarkable brandy note... gracious its as if they aged it in Cognac barrels.... I attribute this to a perfect use of the above mentioned spices to give such an effect while tricking the palate into thinking it the flavors came from something other than spices and vanilla beans.,, because these are complimentary as opposed to dominant notes. The cider has a nice tartness & doesnt taste specifically like a green or a red apple in any sort of general way, but is by all means certainly apple-y.
Well, it looks like this skeptic is won over.
Aroma is apples, juice notes and mild/medium sweetness.  The flavor is apples, juice notes, mild honey notes, medium/thick body and a mix of tartness and mild sweetness in the finish.

Cloudy off orange colored pour w/ some carbonation stuck to the sides of the glass but only a little whisp of soapy head.  Huge apple cider aroma some hints of vanilla and a fair amount of cinnamon and a subtle rich sweetness on the backend.  Well coated clean palate.  The flavor is cinnamon forward reminiscent of drinking fresh hot mulled cider at the apple orchard when I was a kid.  The finish is slightly dry and caries a little bite of that cinnamon stick aftertaste.  Overall a really nice to drink cider.

Poured really hazy, which is a good sign to me.  Sweet apples and a bit of spice on the nose.  Very sweet, and mildly tart.  A bit thick and sticky, but goes down smooth.  For a cider on the sweet side, its very good.

22oz bottle.  Pours an ever so slighly hazy golden yellow with barely any head. High carbonation.  Aroma is huge bright apple, both flesh and skins.  Taste is somewhere between sweet and tart apple, like a combination of gala and granny smith apples.  Some nice spice notes as well but not overwhelming at all; vanilla and cinnamon. Really nice cider, refreshing and warming all at the same time.

Poured from a two year old bottle into a wine glass. Pours a clumpy, translucent copper. Aroma is like a cinnamon apple pie. Smells great! Tastes like apple pie filling. Sweet and a little spicy apples throughout. This is a top notch cider, thats for sure.

Bottle courtesy of weihenweizen. Cloudy golden yellow, no head per usual for cider. Musty sweet tart apple, light spice, vanilla, and maple aroma. Very sweet apple, musty yeast, maple, cinnamon, and vanilla flavor. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very nice, but a bit too sweet for my personal taste. I like my cider on the dry side.
bottle. Cloudy amber. Tart cider with nice spice, perhaps a bit too much if I am being picky. Very light sweetness.

bomber.  Poured clear honeyed golden with just a few loose bubbles around the edges.. nice color to it.  The aroma picked up sweeter, juicy apples paired with cinnamon, maple, and a little honey.. more warm, wintery spices on the back of the nose.. quite nice.  The flavor found more juicy apples and a touch of pear at the core, with complementary cinnamon, tangy apple skins, and a hint of maple around.. finished with good balance between sweet, tangy, and spicy.   Medium-bodied with low carbonation.. good feel on the palate.. great drink!

Pale Yellow orange and somewhat bubbly with a little ring around the rim. Expectedly smells like good apple cider - apple, cinnamon, touch of vanilla and maple. Syrupy, buttery medium body with a zing of alcohol. Apples but not really tart or sour sensations. On the flat side. Cinnamon and vanilla, compliment.
smells of apple cider, wee bit of alcohol.  light golden color, barely there head.  tiny bit of carbonation.  Tastes like apple cider, no other way to describe it.  very smooth and drinkable.

Pours an ultra clear light orange color.  Aroma is freshly cut apples with a hint of cinnamon.  Taste is syrupy sweet, crisp fresh apples.  Finish has a touch a cinnamon and maple syrup.  Really nice cider.  This one is fresher and more spiced than their normal hard cider.

Bottle - Pours hazy amber with no head. Nose is sweet, crisp apple upfront with some dry apple and white grape mingling in. Taste is ripe, sweet apple, a bit of syrupy sugar, and a bit of grape on the finish. Sweet and decadent. Slick and syrupy with no carbonation.

500mL. Pours a low haze darker peach. Soda white foam. Nose is tangerine, apple pie, a quick waft of funky acetic. Moving to more and more acetic. Taste is apple pie, cinnamon, some oil, tangerine, mild acetic sourness. Yummy, funky.
First shot a had cider and it does not disappoint. Taste is apple juice with a strong element of apple pie flavor. I like this as a change. Very drinkable.

First sip was a blast of electric on the tongue, almost like a 9 volt battery.  Wow.   Spices are very dominant, but they are not complex or overwhelming in any way.   Liquid apple-pie.  Rich yet supple apples fill the mouth, and the finish is quite sweet.  Probably just a bit too sweet for my liking.  Well-made nonetheless.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Refrigerated bottle poured into a white wine glass.  Pours slightly hazy light golden, low carbonation, aroma apple with a hint of cinnamon.  Taste is complex sweet rich apples, some cinnamon, some vanilla, and a hint of maple syrup.  This is a really wonderful cider.
A very good cider.  Great flavor.  Hard to find but well worth it.  The only flaw is the aftertaste.  It is hard to describe but I find it unpleasant.
Pours a darker yellow with no head.  Aroma of apples and cinnamon.  Taste is clean like alcoholic apple sauce.  No real aftertaste.

The bottle should mention: incredibly sweet.  I also thought the "light" spicing was actually rather heavy-handed.  Had a hard time finishing my (chilled) 8 oz glass of this. Just too sweet, not what I am personally looking for in a craft cider.  On the other had this made a KILLER addition to some pork gravy I was making....

Pale copper pour looks just like apple juice thin ring of white head .... aroma of apples and sugary .... taste is of light cinnamon, a touch of maple and apples .... very apple juice like but a little unnaturally sweetened ... mouthfeel has some apple skin to it .... little too sweet but abv hidden well and solid cider

Bottle from earth fare. Pours apple color with no head and very little carbonation to speak of. Smells like apples. Taste is very sweet as though they combined cider with a bag of potpourri. The taste stays in your mouth long after its gone. Not my favorite example of the style.
Bottle - star supermarket - pours a clear amber with no head. Taste is sweeter than many ciders, like a mulled cider.

Nose is full of fresh apple juice and a hint of cinnamon with some alcohol in the background. Poured a light tan color with some small bubbles forming around the glass. Taste was incredibly delectable with sweet, rich apple flavor followed by a mild cinnamon spice and a masked but present hint of vanilla. It reminded me of apple sauce with cinnamon. Excellent cider that went over well at the Christmas get-together.

Tasted on 12/20/11 from a capped 650mL bomber bottle, thank you to Jane.  Pours a hazy bronzed golden with a thin, fizzy white head that quickly recedes to nothing at all.  The nose is sweet apple juice and maple, with very light aromas of vanilla and cinnamon spices.  The flavor is, once again, pretty sweet apple, with the vanilla and maple showing nicely, and the cinnamon coming through more strongly than on the nose.  The body is full with lightly fizzy carbonation, and a very long sweet apple and cinnamon spice finish, along with a bit of a tannic texture.

Tallahassee, Fl - Earth Fare - 22 oz bomber. Murky dark golden pour, not much of a head. Fresh floral aroma, some sour apple notes. Tasty flavor - tastes like biting into a fresh crisp golden delicious apple. Thick and chewy and very natural - not artificial and alcopop-like some more mass-produced ciders. Thick, rich mouthfeel. Solid, just like its little brother.

Pours a nice n cloudy yellow with not much for a head. Smells like an apple pie! Good malty God this drink is sweet, loads of apples, brown sugar and just a hint of maple to make for a very sweet finish. The aftertaste is tangy and fresh, there arent many ciders that could go up against this one.

11/29/11. 22oz bottle. Cloudy light copper pour with no head at all despite a straight pour into the glass. Faint aroma with a touch of apple juice, yeast, and a bit of something meaty. Sweet apple flavor that reminds of store bought apple juice... very much like apple juice. Theres maybe a very very small touch of yeast, vanilla, and cinnamon in there. The carbonation is also very small, almost not present, which again makes it almost exactly like apple juice. At 7%, this is dangerous... but I can see the sweetness becoming tiring.
Pours a golden color with a fizzy head that quickly dissipates. Notes of red candied apples, cinnamon apple chips, caramel, and vanilla. Semi sparkling mouthfeel and sweetness on the back end.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2011 Aroma from the neck: Fruit, floral/roses, cinnamon & other spices. Pours slightly cloudy golden with moderate carbonation. Easy drinking, with apples, cinnamon, nutmeg, and a bit of a pucker on the end. Very well balanced with not much alcohol note. This is a sweet, aromatic, and VERY enjoyable cider. Kind of a cross between Martinellis and a spiced cider. Nice and full bodied, and I would guess welcomed by nearly everyone as a good afternoon Winter warmer. Goes really nice with pumpkin pie! Tasted @ 50F.

Pours clear gold into a snifter. White head quickly recedes to nothing. Apple and cinnamon aromas. Soft with sweet apple, cinnamon and maple front to back. Little to no apparent alcohol other than in the warmth.

JKs is wonderful....... If you are only having a bit of it.  Let me explain. This cider looks, tastes and feels like freshly pressed cider. However, it is so sweet that the sweetness becomes overpowering towards the end of a 10 oz pour, nevermind the whole bottle. Two of us shared this as dessert after some great bbq and neither one one of us finished his glass. Overall, I like it despite that it is not very drinkable.
Pours a clear pale yellow, aroma of apples.  Tastes like apple juice, with some vanilla smoothness and spice.  A nice winter drink.
Very sweet in a good way. Not syrupy. Tastes like nonalcoholic cider. Thick and good.
Bottle.  Above average cider, rich apple juice golden in color.  Fruity and spicy nose, easy drinking.
Pours a nice brownish yellow. Apple and cinnamon on the nose. Carries over into the flavor. No hint of alcohol at all.

Bomber. Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with no head. Has a nice aroma of apples and cinnamon. Smells like wintertime. Has a fantastic spiced flavor. Highly carbonated. Best cider Ive ever had by far. Makes me look forward to colder days.

Sweet, spicy, and no boozy flavor at all. Hands down my favorite cider. Great stuff for a non cider lover. I try and keep a bottle or 2 on hand to share when rarely drinking friends come over. Its always a big hit and has livened up more than one evening.
The aroma is very sweet and spicy with apples and maple syrup. The appearance is hazy gold orange with no head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is thin. Overall this is a really good cider.
this cider reminds of autumn with apple, spicy nutmeg and cinnamon its very sweet and very rich. slight acidic. with the carbonation slightly fizzy.
Bottle: pours a hazy straw color, aroma of apples and spices, tastes the same. My wife is a big fan of this one. Says it is the best cider she has ever had.

Bottle. Poured golden with a quick white head. Aroma of tart apple and a light farmhouse background. The flavor found apple pie; apple, cinnamon, and a light malt backing. Light to medium body. Slight tart up front and a nice sweet ending.

bottle-i must say this is the best cider i have ever had!!!!! dark yellow with a small fizzy white head.  apple yard nose-so fresh!  its amazing!  like a fresh baked apple pie.  sweet , sticky apple flavors .  long sweet apple finish not too tard not too sour.  just perfect!  i will have MANY" of these when i can find them!

(bottle - 22 oz) Hazy gold pour with a fizzy white head. Huge spice and apple aroma. Lots of cinnamon and clove. Flavor is spiced heavily. Cinnamon, clove, apples and a light touch of syrup. Smooth and very sweet. Probably would taste good warmed up.
Pours a hazy dark golden with a thin white head. Aroma is cinnamon spiced apples. Flavor is sweet apple, cinnamon, like liquid apple pie. My favorite cider yet.

Sampled at Flossmoor Tapping (Flossmoor, IL). Pours a glowing orange hue, touches of haziness, no real head. Aromas are crisp honey apples, tart granny smith, touches of honey, fresh apples, light honey, touches of sweet fruits. Initial is honeycrisp apples, honey, some tartness. Light fruitiness, touches of cinnamon like spiciness. Some touches of oak, vanilla, more honeycrisp apples. Finish is lingering sweetness, touch of tartness. A sweeter cider, which isnt really my style in the cider game. Ok.

Bomber. Pours a slightly petillant gold with tiny tiny white bubbles. The aroma is mellow fresh apple, a little bit of cinnamon, and a tame sweetness. The flavor is smooth tasty apple, a touch of cinnamon, and a lovely smooth vanilla that wasnt evident in the nose. The maple is noticeable in the aftertaste. Its fairly sweet, but a little bit of an acidic edge cuts through it to keep from becoming cloying. This is surprisingly good.
Bottle. Clear orange amber color. Vanilla, cinnamon, apple pie aromas. medium bodied. Nice vanilla, cinnamon, maple syrup, ripe apple flavors---pretty sweet
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle.  Courtesy of Will and Mike, thank you gentlemen!   Bright golden color.  Tons of apple, lemon in the nose.  Lots of apple flavor, clean and bright taste, a great palate cleanser.  Good stuff.

Nice, crisp, sweet, slightly buttery apple aroma.  Good bottle, mostly clear honey gold.  Very sweet dessert cider, muted spiciness.  Heavy body, lights up your tongue.  Very well done, this is a slow-sippin affair.  Thanks to LuckyDog for hauling this back from someplace in central or northeast Florida.
22oz bottle, split with a friend, sweet aroma, apples, a bit of vanilla, cinnamon, I cant get much of a honey or syrup flavor, drinkable and delicious.

Appearance: Pours out a hazed, golden-toned body.

Smell: An opening aroma of apple, lightly tart and lightly sweet, followed by vanilla and cinnamon spice. A long sniffing session finally yields a hint of the rumored maple.

Taste: Sugary sweet taste of apple juice spiced lightly with cinnamon. A faint, fleeting earthiness precludes the vanilla and maple which is punctuated by a bit of alcohol and apple tartness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-low carbonation.

Drinkability: Its tasty, sweet, and reasonably spiced. A nice seasonal offering.

22 oz bottle shared with Lynn. Pours a light honey color of orange and gold. Nose is sugary cinnamon apple pie. Medium body with just a bit of carbonation. Taste is leaning towards the sweet apples with a bit of tartness, some spicy cinnamon, and a little maple syrup underneath it all. Finish is sweet and sticky. Very nice cider.

Bottles from Whole Foods. Consumed in between the holidays from pint glasses.

Disturbed sediment, out the cider came a hazy(though vibrant) gold. Thin, skim milk head.

Chalky cinnamon, mild bulk cider(edging towards sweet), small hint of maple syrup, citric acid, & a hearty amount of doughy yeast round out the smell.

Taste-wise, spices arent intense, though you could say the amount of vanilla used is a bit much. Mushy golden delicious apples(apple complexity is mostly lost in this blend), caramelized without the added body(thankfully). Sweet & not much acidity. The alcohol is more then noticeable on the finish.

Mouthfeel is powdery with a slight heft to it. Decent beaded carbonation that could take to being a bit stronger even.

A nice change of pace.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

text: Light orange hued, golden, and a thin white ring.  Aroma is spiced, mulled cider, freshly pressed cider, but dulled.  Taste is more cinnamon, clove, fleshy cider, sweet candy finish.
This is a fantastic sweet cider. I got a darker caramel sweetness with hints of spices (cinnamon).
Even mix of apples and cinnamon on the nose. Clear amber. Sweet fresh apple flavor, a little body, and cinnamon toward the end. Very much like liquid apple pie.

Totally awesome winter cider--like apple pie in a glass.  Nothing wrong with that as long as you like apple pie (with a bite).  Fresh apple flavor seasoned with just the right amount of spice--not overdone, not over sweet.  Nutmeg, caramel, cinnamon.  Just delicious, perfect for a cold winter night spent around the fireplace.

Tasted from a 22oz bottle purchase at FreshCraft in Denver, Colorado.  Pretty hazy light golden orange appearance.  Spicy apple aroma- hints of nutmeg, vanilla, and definitely cinnamon.  I could smell the beer from three feet away and it smells like fresh apple pie.  Cinnamon and almost a roasty apple flavored body.  A little wine-like as other ciders usually are but it is less pronounced than others.

Pours a straw-colored yellow with considerable cloudiness.  Aroma is primarily of maple syrup and secondarily of apples--definitely sweet.  Taste is, first and foremost, sweet.  The flavor of the apple is evenly matched by the additions of vanilla, cinnamon, and maple syrup, each of which is discernible.  Alcohol is noticeable and becomes more so as the cider warms. But even when cool to cold, the cider is extremely flavorful.  In spite of this sweetness, theres a certain dryness where the cider itself is concerned--quite crisp.  Mouthfeel is lively, with tingly carbonation--just about what youd expect for a cider.  In sum, this may be the best cider Ive tried.  Now, I know that the additions of the vanilla, cinnamon, and syrup dont make for the most "authentic" cider. Whatever. This is seriously flavorful, and while some may find the sweetness too cloying (entirely possible), youd be missing out on something special if you passed this one by.

This is a great and sophisticated cider. A very bright gold coloring is filling with bubbles that snap crackle and pop on the surface. The aroma is a light sweet apple with that background of vanilla and almost savory cinnamon. The taste is tart with some challenging tannin sting to it. Makes a complex cider that is still impossible to put down.
Aroma shows the big vanilla influence and just a hint of the maple syrup.  Flavor is quite sweet and delicious, like liquid apple pie filling with a good hit of cinnamon.

Like liquid apple pie. Huge apple aroma with lots of nutmeg, cinnamon, and clove. Even a few bready notes to give the feel of crust. Some caramel notes lend even more to the pie illusion. I could drink a lot of this!

12/30/2009:  J.K.s Solstice Farmhouse Hard Cider...  Aroma:  Apple pie (fresh apples, hints of cinammon, even a little doughy).  Appearance:  Hazy, golden color; suspended sediment that quickly settles.  Flavor:  High sweetness and mead-like with a slight maple twist in the front; crisp, fresh apple in the middle; hints of soft vanilla; a welcomed bit of cinammon spice; nicely balanced overall.  Palate:  Medium-bodied; smooth; not thin at all.  Overall:  This is a really nice and enjoyable cider; my wife would probably really like this one!
Bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Thanks Tom!  Rating #21 for this beer.

Smells like pie, tastes like pie.  Crust, Granny Smith apples, baked till theyre soft with a tiny crunch and caramelized sugar, little sticky, cinnamon all warm out of the oven.  It tastes like food.  I dont drink this WITH dessert, I drink it FOR dessert.

Bottle. The body was medium amber colored with a thin white head on top. The nose was cinnamon with lots of apple pie. Some good crusty character along with caramel. The taste was vanilla and lots of cinnamon. Like drinking a liquid apple pie. A pleasure, but certainly a sipper.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2010 A bomber given to me from a friend at work!  Thank you Brian!  Looks like good homemade cider, somewhat like a hazy hef. No signs of visible carbonation within. Some gunk on bottom of the bottle. Smell is sweet like apple juice. Lots of cinnamon on the initial taste. Not a fan of cinnamon in cider but at least at first its not overwhelming. Comes across somewhat artificial at times buit still not bad. Not sure if I like these other flavorings in my apple cider.  Doesnt seem to come across like 7%.  Very little CO2 in this stuff. Apple is there but agtain there may be too much other stuff in here to make it sessionable. Fairly good and enjoyable, Certainly a holiday drink. This would be right at home on a cool fall day. Yep, does not really seem to be 7% at all, goes down way too easy. Finish is fruity fine with just a tad of medicinal feel to it. Not a bad spiced cider. Would not mind having again!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: First off, I think that one is rating a cider, they should rate it as a cider, and not a beer.  Having said this, the cider has a nice aroma... you can smell the vanilla and a bit of alcohol.  Its not a strong aroma by any means.  The appearance is what you would expect of very cloudy apple cider.  The Flavor is very very sweet of course, and it blends well with the vanilla and other spices but inevitably they are overpowered by the apple.  I find myself wanting more of the spices, but then I am drinking apple cider, and they are not meant to be the main course.  Pretty decent stuff.

Bomber. Pours hazy gold, no head. Aroma is very much like non-alcoholic cider with cinnamon, This is probably the sweetest smelling cider ever, quite surprising. Flavor is very sweet apple, cinnamon, slightly on the syrupy side. This tastes very natural to me and would be fabulous to drink in autumn. I could see how some people might find this to be too sweet. I dont know as I could drink more than one glass.

Pours a cloudy golden color.  Aroma is of apples, nutmeg, cinnamon, and maple syrup.  Flavors include apples, cinnamon, and spices.  Has a great sweet apple finish.  For 6.9% abv, this is smooth and tastes just like apple cider.  I could drink this all day.

Pours a hazy golden color with light carbonation effervescing on top.  The aroma is rather cider-ish, vinuous.  Definitely apples coming through but also a lovely mixture of spices of which cinnamon is most notable.  Tastey cinnamon, sweet apples...man, this really smells wonderful!  It honestly reminds me of apple pie.  Very easy to drink.  Tastey cinnamon compliments the apple wonderfully.
Smells like straight-up apple juice. Spices make it pleasant. Cinnamon, vanilla, even a little maple syrup. Tastes delicious and a nice change of pace from most other "dry" ciders.

Pours and looks like apple cider.  That is a good thing.  Nose is fresh apples, cinnamon and I catch the maple also.  Nice apple and spice flavor.  Sweet, but not overly so.  Something in the finish is a little weird.  Something is throwing me off.  Maybe the vanilla, I think it could be the maple.  This is still nice but I like the original better.

Delicious must-taste cider and winter beer. Amazing flavor profile brings out the vanilla and spice while remaining a true apple cider. Aroma is just as lovely, with apples cinnamon and vanilla weaving together.

In the bottle from Beertopia. Pours a dark reddish gold to amber color with a rapidly disseminating effervescent head. The aroma is fairly standard apple cider with little indication of the treat awaiting. The four-part flavor blast runs from apples to sweetness to vanilla to tartness. Jumping around in there is a jangle of cinnamon, but only a bit. This is like an apple pie in a bottle. Just incredible. My only knock on it is the unnecessary marketing scheme of having it be "organic." All that does for the beer is raise its price. I think that this was the best holiday treat of 2009.

Bottle from Keg Liquor. Poured clear copper color with a minimal white head that diminished quickly with minimal lacing. Moderate aroma of tart apple and spice. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet apple flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations were met.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy gold. Aroma is apples and cinnamon. Flavor is apples, cinnamon, maple, and vanilla. Basically no carbonation, but the mouthfeel is still nice. Long, mouthwatering finish. Alcohol almost unnoticeable.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2010 22oz  The Wine Source.  Chill hazed gold.  Thick apple cinnamon aromas ride softer layers of maple vanilla and hints of clove.  Similar in flavor with soft sweet apple spice tones warming to light vanilla bean and maple finish.  Medium bodied and slick, light carbonation, soft apple spice finish.  If cider is your thing, this one is not to be missed.  Very well done

Bottle with sediment on the bottom. Pours a hazy golden body with a white ring. Some bubbles rising throughout. Aroma of apple juice, cinnamon, brown sugar, maple and a bit of raisins. Sweet, earthy and slightly minerally. Light alcohol tinge. Flavor is a whole lot better than the regular Scrumpy. Still sweet, but not cloying. More of an applesauce thing going on. Cinnamon, minerals, vanilla. Light bubbles and a decent thickness (high F.G.). Light tangy citrus-apple pie thing going on in the finish.  Still un-naturally sweet, but loads better than their first attempt. They actually make the sweetness work in this one.

Bottle from Brother Eric as a b-day gift. Pours thera-flu semi-clear pale orange with not much head to speak of. Nose is rich cider, cinnamon spice and slight vinegar. Taste is sweet and pleasant apple cider, cinnamon, some slight clove and vanilla, as well as a very small hing of maple that really compliments nicely. The flavor is really smooth and lightly carbonated which is perfect for the style of beer this is as well as the flavor it brings. The hint of vinegar on the nose turned me off at first because I have a strong dislike of said flavor, yet it is nowhere to be found in the taste, which is an added bonus, for me anyway. Excellent to sip on, yet each taste leaves me wanting another. Apple spice flavor lingers in the mouth for a long, long finish. I opened my first Christmas present of the season earlier today, but this beer is what marked the start of the holidays IMHO. As the bottle suggested, I couldnt help but try it warmed as well. 30 seconds on high produced a significant sharp bite on the back of the throat, as well as a much more pronounced cinnamon/spice, but overall I think the flavors diminished a little. Cold wins for me....going back in the fridge. Excellent Winter Beer!

Bottle.  Pours a hazy light amber brown without much of a head.  A touch vinous, with a bit of cinnamon, and some old apple aromas.  Medium bodied, very little carbonation.  Earthy cinnamon and some sweet vanilla.  Lightly sweet finish with more vanilla and warmed apple pie.

Pours a viscous slightly hazy golden brass color with a thin ring of white bubbles.  Has a sweet apple juice nose with some light grassy hay and mild fruity tartness.  Starts with a thick sweet applesauce flavor and a touch of cinnamon along with some good light tart balance before a sticky sweet apple finish.  Has a nice full apple flavor, about halfway to being an ice cider.

500 mL bottle from Whole Foods Market, Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy pale orange color with no head. Aroma is sweet, syrupy apples with a bit of a tart note, much like apple juice. Taste is tart apples, cinnamon, maple and vanilla that shows up more as the cider warms. Very well spiced and very tasty. Medium bodied.

Wow, this cider left me with a huge smile on my face.  The higher alcohol is not apparent at all.  It has a great cloudy color that reminds me of an unfiltered wheat beer.  Has a nice head like beer too.  Then the taste is a softly sweet apple with that creamy vanilla undertone that sets it apart from any other cider Ive had.  I tried this one cold but Ive heard it is great warmed up with a cinnamon stick and some orange zest.  Yum.
